description: Largest palindromic substring in n! without an initial zero.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
mathematica: isPal[d_List] := d[[1]] != 0 && d == Reverse[d]; Table[d = IntegerDigits[n!]; k = Length[d]; While[s = Select[Partition[d, k, 1], isPal]; s == {}, k--]; Max[FromDigits /@ s], {n, 0, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Mar 25 2011 *)
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Jun 15 1998.
